conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible interior volume, angled/isometric camera, and ceiling/roof removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and readable wall/floor separation; corners and wall tops are coherent. Minor simplification of some junctions and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Major zones (central hall, kitchen, dining, breakfast area, stair/entry zone) broadly correspond, but small service rooms from the plan (WC, utility, pantry/crawl access area) are not clearly represented or are merged/simplified; several internal partitions/opening locations appear shifted.

interior_elements.notes: Dining table and kitchen casework/island are present and plausibly scaled. Bathroom/utility fixtures from the 2D plan are missing/not identifiable.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with distinguishable walls/floors/windows, but text labels on the floor reduce presentation quality and can distract from geometric verification.

detected_errors.description: Service-core layout fidelity issue: WC/utility/pantry/crawl access regions shown in 2D are not clearly modeled as distinct rooms, suggesting merging/omission and partition misplacement.
Door/opening placement and count do not consistently match the 2D plan (some openings appear relocated or simplified).
Missing bathroom/utility fixtures and related interior elements that would help confirm room identities.
Text labels embedded in the 3D image contaminate presentation and reduce clarity scoring.

summary: This is a valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric modeling, but it only moderately preserves the 2D plan’s detailed service-room geometry and opening placement.
